title: What is the process involved in the alchemical transformation of Sulphur, as described in the Turba Philosophorum?
first_phrase: In the previous text, the "Turba Philosophorum" discusses the alchemic process of transforming a compound using fire to achieve perfection. In the last 200 tokens, Pitagora talks about an element that attracts and transforms without fire but with diverse colors. They called it "the spit of the Moon." Additionally, they discuss the "black hen" transformation process where the blood of the hen produces white and shiny feathers. The text concludes by warning against the dangerous deviation of incomplete mortification.
content: E questa cosa, nell'ab braccio, manifesta diversi colori, e la si trova dappertutto; Pietra e non è Pietra: cara e vile, chiara e preziosa, oscura e conosciuta da tutti, non ha che un nome e ne ha molti; ed è lo sputo della Luna (3).
